stems.text:
The term 'Britain' is used both as a synonym for Great Britain, and as a synonym for the United Kingdom. Usage is mixed: the UK Government prefers to use the term 'UK' rather than 'Britain' or 'British' on its own website (except when referring to embassies). The UK Permanent Committee on Geographical Names recognises 'United Kingdom' and 'UK or U.K.' as shortened and abbreviated geopolitical terms for the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland in its toponymic guidelines; it does not list 'Britain' but notes 'it is only the one specific nominal term 'Great Britain' which invariably excludes Northern Ireland.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: The UK government refers to its own embassies under the term UK
The UK Permanent Committee on Geographical Names chooses the names of things in the UK
The term ‘Britain’ is used more than the term ‘UK’
The term ‘Great Britain’ is not used as it does not include Northern Ireland
The term ‘United Kingdom’ includes Ireland
questions.explanation:
1. The UK government uses the term “Britain” or “British” on its own website, as indicated where it states that the government prefers to use the term UK over Britain or British, except when referring to embassies. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We can’t tell for sure whether the UK Permanent Committee on Geographical Names chooses the names of things in the UK as all we know is that it recognises the United Kingdom and UK as shortened terms for the full geographical name. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We cannot conclude that the term Britain is used more than UK purely based on this information alone. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. We know that ‘Great Britain’ excluded Northern Ireland, however we do not know that this is the reason the term Great Britain is not used. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. The term United Kingdom is short for the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, however we do not know if Ireland is included in this name or not (or if it is just Northern Ireland that is included). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

stems.text:
The Constitution of the United Kingdom is uncodified and consists mostly of a collection of disparate written sources, including statutes, judge-made case law and international treaties, together with constitutional conventions. As there is no technical difference between ordinary statutes and 'constitutional law', the UK Parliament can perform 'constitutional reform' simply by passing Acts of Parliament, and thus has the political power to change or abolish almost any written or unwritten element of the constitution. No Parliament can pass laws that future Parliaments cannot change.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: The Constitution of the United Kingdom is a single document
There are no differences whatsoever between constitutional law and ordinary statutes
Acts of Parliament can be passed in the same way as ordinary statutes
The UK Parliament can change aspects of the UK’s Constitution
A future parliament in the UK can always change past laws
questions.explanation:
1. It states that the Constitution of the United Kingdom consists of a collection of disparate written sources, so it is not one document. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We only know that there is no technical difference between the two, but we do not know that there are no differences whatsoever. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We cannot tell that they are passed in the same way as we have no information about how either the Acts of Parliament or ordinary statutes are passed. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. It states that the UK Parliament can perform constitutional reform and has the political power to change or abolish almost any written or unwritten element of the constitution. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. It states that no parliament can pass laws that future parliaments cannot change. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
The position of prime minister, the UK's head of government, belongs to the person most likely to command the confidence of the House of Commons; this individual is typically the leader of the political party or coalition of parties that holds the largest number of seats in that chamber. The prime minister chooses a cabinet and its members are formally appointed by the monarch to form Her Majesty's Government. By convention, the monarch respects the prime minister's decisions of government.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: The Prime Minister of the UK is elected by the population
The monarch of the UK chooses the cabinet members
It is uncommon for the monarch to change the composition of the proposed cabinet members
The UK Parliament is also known as Her Majesty’s Government
There can be situations where the Prime Minister does not lead the party with the greatest number of parliamentary seats
questions.explanation:
1. We do not know how the prime minister is elected. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We only know that the prime minister chooses members of cabinet, so we do not know if the monarch has any influence in regards to that or not. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. It states that by convention, the monarch respects the prime minister’s decisions of government, which implies that usually the monarch does not interfere with the prime minister’s cabinet choices as well. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. The UK Parliament is not mentioned in the passage so we cannot make this conclusion. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. It states that the prime minister is typically the leader of the political party or coalition of parties that holds the largest number of seats in that chamber, however as it uses the word ‘typically’, it is implied that there are situations where the prime minister can lead the party that does not have the greatest number of parliamentary seats. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Wind farms, which are arrays of large turbines, are becoming an increasingly important source of intermittent renewable energy and are used by many countries as part of a strategy to reduce their reliance on fossil fuels. One assessment claimed that, as of 2009, wind had the 'lowest relative greenhouse gas emissions, the least water consumption demands and... the most favourable social impacts' compared to photovoltaic, hydro, geothermal, coal and gas.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recycling

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Wind farms have the lowest greenhouse gas emissions of any energy source
Any large collection of large turbines is known as a wind farm
Geothermal energy production uses up more water than wind farms
Energy produced from coal produces more greenhouse gas emissions than the energy generated from hydro
Wind farms are being used by some countries to help move away from fossil fuels
questions.explanation:
. The passage only states that wind farms have the lowest relative greenhouse gas emissions compared to photovoltaic, hydro, geothermal, coal and gas energy, so we cannot say that it has the lowest greenhouse gas emissions of any energy source. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. A wind farm is an array of large turbines, however we do not know that any large collection of large turbines is known as a wind farm (ie. we do not know the all collections or arrays of large turbines are known as wind farms). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. Since wind farms have the least water consumption demands compared to photovoltaic, hydro, geothermal, coal and gas energy, we can conclude that geothermal energy uses more water than wind farms. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. We do not have any information comparing hydro to coal energy. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. Wind farms are used by many countries as part of a strategy to reduce their reliance on fossil fuels. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
In the strictest sense, recycling of a material would produce a fresh supply of the same material. This is accomplished when recycling certain types of materials, such as metal cans, which can become a can again and again, indefinitely, without losing purity in the product. However, this is often difficult or too expensive, so 'recycling' of many products or materials involves their reuse in producing different materials (for example, paperboard) instead.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Recycling

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: If a paper is recycled, it can only be remade into paper again
Reusing certain materials for producing new materials can be classified as recycling
Recycling metal cans as metal cans again is too expensive to do
The recycling of products through reusing them to produce different things result in the original product losing its purity
Theoretically, one metal can be recycled forever
questions.explanation:
1. Theoretically, recycling follows this process, however as stated in the passage recycling of many products involves their reuse in producing different materials. Thus, if a paper is recycled it could become any number of different things. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. Since recycling of many products involves their reuse in producing different materials, we can infer that reusing materials to create different materials can be classified as recycling. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
3. The passage states that recycling in the strictest sense, producing a fresh supply of the same material, is too difficult or expensive. Thus recycling metal cans as metal cans again can be too expensive, but it could also be too difficult so we can’t be sure that it is too expensive for sure. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. We cannot draw any conclusions about the relative purity of recycling products through reusing them to produce different things (we only know that recycling materials into the same materials does not lose purity). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. Theoretically, if a can were to be recycled, it would produce a fresh supply of the same material without losing any purity, which means 100% of the material is reused to create a new can every time. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Historically, indigenous British people were thought to be descended from the various ethnic groups that settled there before the 12th century: the Celts, Romans, Anglo-Saxons, Norse and the Normans. Welsh people could be the oldest ethnic group in the UK. A 2006 genetic study shows that more than 50 per cent of England's gene pool contains Germanic Y chromosomes. Another 2005 genetic analysis indicates that 'about 75 per cent of the traceable ancestors of the modern British population had arrived in the British isles by about 6,200 years ago, at the start of the British Neolithic or Stone Age'.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Kingdom

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Celts, Romans, Anglo-Saxons, Norse and Normans were the only ethnic groups to settle in Britain before the 12th century
Welsh people existed in Britain before the 12th century
Some ancestors of people in England were from Germany
The British Neolithic Age occurred before the 12th century
Genetic analyses can be used to trace a person’s ancestry
questions.explanation:
1. Based on the information in the passage, we cannot be certain that these were the only ethnic groups settled at the time that we know of. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We know Welsh people were the oldest ethnic group in the UK, but we do not know if they were the oldest ethnic group in Britain (Britain and the UK are not the same thing). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We know that 50% of England’s gene pool contains Germanic Y chromosomes, but we cannot use this information to say that some ancestors of people in England were from Germany (how do we know that these Germanic chromosomes came from Germany, or Germany as it is known now?). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. The start of the British Neolithic age was 6,200 years ago, while the 12th century was only around 8-9 centuries ago (800-900 years), at least nowhere near 6,200 years ago. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. It states that another 2005 genetic analysis indicates that about 75% of the traceable ancestors of the modern British population had arrived in the British Isles by about 6,200 years ago – thus we can infer that genetic analyses can determine some traceable ancestors. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
The term 'penicillin' was used originally for benzylpenicillin, penicillin G. Currently, 'Penicillin' is used as a generic term for antibiotics that contain the beta lactam unit in the chemical structure. For example, amoxicillin tablets may be labelled as 'a penicillin'. Other derivatives such as procaine benzylpenicillin (procaine penicillin), benzathine benzylpenicillin (benzathine penicillin), and phenoxymethylpenicillin (penicillin V) are also described as 'penicillins'. Procaine penicillin and benzathine penicillin have the same antibacterial activity as benzylpenicillin but act for a longer period of time.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penicillin

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Benzylpenicillin was the first form of penicillin
Currently penicillin is used for a variety of antibiotics
Penicillin G contains the beta lactam unit in its chemical structure
Procaine benzylpenicillin has the same chemical structure as benzathine penicillin
Modern antibiotics classified as penicillin have at least 1 similar structural chemical feature
questions.explanation:
1. The term penicillin was originally used for benzylpenicillin, however that does not mean that benzylpenicillin was the first form of penicillin. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. In the passage, around at least 4 antibiotics are listed as being labelled as penicillin or described as such, but we do not know that penicillin is an actual compound in these drugs (all we know from this passage is that it is a name used to label drugs). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We know penicillin G was originally called penicillin, however we do not know if ‘currently’ this is still the case, so we don’t know if it has the beta lactam unit in its chemical structure. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. We know they share the beta lactam unit, but other than that we have no information on their similarities. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. Currently, antibiotics classified as penicillin share the beta lactam unit in their chemical structure. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
According to the principle of conservation of mechanical energy, the mechanical energy of an isolated system remains constant in time, as long as the system is free of friction and other non-conservative forces. In any real situation, frictional forces and other non-conservative forces are present, but in many cases their effects on the system are so small that the principle of conservation of mechanical energy can be used as a fair approximation. Though energy cannot be created or destroyed in an isolated system, it can be converted to another form of energy.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mechanical_energy

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Theoretically, a system cannot have any friction
If a system has non-conservative forces, the mechanical energy of that system will remain constant
The principle of conservation of mechanical energy can be used whether friction is present or not
In a non-isolated system, energy can be created
Mechanical energy can be converted into another form of energy in an isolated system
questions.explanation:
1. According to the principle of conservation of mechanical energy, the mechanical energy of an isolated system remains constant in time, as long as the system is free of friction. Thus, in principle, a system can be free of friction. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. The system also needs to be free of friction, so if it only has non-conservative forces, we cannot guarantee that the mechanical energy of the system will remain constant. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. The principle of conservation of mechanical energy is used when friction is not present, however it can still be used when frictional forces are so small in effect. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. We cannot tell this based on the information provided. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. The passage states that energy can be converted into another form of energy in an isolated system, so we can infer that in an isolated system mechanical energy can be converted into another form. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Electrical energy is energy derived from electric potential energy or kinetic energy. When used loosely, electrical energy refers to energy that has been converted from electric potential energy. This energy is supplied by the combination of electric current and electric potential that is delivered by an electrical circuit (e.g., provided by an electric power utility). At the point that this electric potential energy has been converted to another type of energy, it ceases to be electric potential energy. Thus, all electrical energy is potential energy before it is delivered to the end-use. Once converted from potential energy, electrical energy can always be called another type of energy (heat, light, motion, etc.).
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electrical_energy

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Electric potential energy always produces electrical energy
Electrical energy is mostly derived from electric potential energy
Once potential energy converts to another form of energy, it is no longer potential energy
Electrical energy cannot be called motion energy before it is converted from electric potential energy
Electric power utilities can be used to provide electric current and electric potential energy
questions.explanation:
1. We know that electric potential energy can be converted into electrical energy, however there is nothing to suggest that electric potential energy ONLY produces electrical energy. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. Electrical energy can also be derived from kinetic energy, however we do not know what proportion of electrical energy is derived from kinetic vs electric potential energy. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. There is nothing to suggest this as a general rule applying to potential energy. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. Electrical energy can always be called another type of energy including motion energy, once converted from potential energy. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. The passage states that electric current and electric potential is delivered by an electrical circuit provided by an electrical power utility as one example. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Nuclear binding energy is the minimum energy that would be required to disassemble the nucleus of an atom into its component parts. These component parts are neutrons and protons, which are collectively in the presence of each other called nucleons. The binding energy is always a positive number, as we need to spend energy in moving these nucleons, attracted to each other by the strong nuclear force, away from each other.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nuclear_binding_energy

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Protons by themselves cannot be called nucleons
The consumption energy of something will be a negative number
Disassembling the nucleus of an atom requires a lot of energy
An atom’s nucleus can only be disassembled if enough nuclear binding energy is present or used
Electrons are not component parts of a nucleus
questions.explanation:
1. Nucleons are neutrons and protons in the presence of each other, so alone they cannot be called nucleons. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. Just because the binding energy is always a positive number does not mean the consumption energy must be a negative number. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We do not know if nuclear binding energy is a lot of energy or not. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. Nuclear binding energy refers to the minimum energy required, not necessarily the energy itself that is used to disassemble the nucleus. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. The passage states that the component parts of the nucleus are neutrons and protons, so we can infer that electrons are not component parts of a nucleus. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Convective circulation allows one body to heat another, through an intermediate circulating fluid that carries energy from a boundary of one to a boundary of the other; the actual heat transfer is by conduction and radiation between the fluid and the respective bodies. Convective circulation, though spontaneous, does not necessarily and immediately occur simply because of some slight temperature difference; for it to occur in a given arrangement of systems, there is a threshold that must be crossed.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: If a hot iron touches a shirt, which then becomes hot, this is an example of convective circulation
If a cold metal stick becomes hot after it is contact with another hot metal stick, this is an example of convection
Convective circulation is instantaneous
Convective circulation does not always occur
Convective circulation requires a fluid to work
questions.explanation:
1. Convective circulation uses an intermediate fluid that carries energy from one boundary of a place to another, however this is not the case if a hot iron touches a shirt (which uses steam not liquid). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We only know what convective circulation is, not necessarily convection, however this example is not an example of convection anyway. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. Convective circulation is spontaneous, but does not necessarily and immediately occur. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. For convective circulation to occur in a given arrangement of systems, there is a threshold that must be crossed. If this is not crossed, then convective circulation will not occur (or so we can infer). Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. Convective circulation uses an intermediate fluid that carries energy from one boundary of a body to another boundary of another body. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Heat capacity is a measurable physical quantity equal to the ratio of the heat added to an object to the resulting temperature change. The molar heat capacity is the heat capacity per unit amount (units: mole) of a pure substance, and the specific heat capacity, often called simply specific heat, is the heat capacity per unit mass of a material. Heat capacity is a physical property of a substance, which means that it depends on the state and properties of the substance under consideration.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heat

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: If the molar heat capacity of water is 4.18, the heat capacity per mole of water is also 4.18
The molar heat capacity of a pure substance can go by multiple names
The heat capacity of solid ice will be different to the heat capacity of liquid water
The specific heat capacity of a gaseous substance can be the same as that of a solid substance
Heat capacity cannot be calculated without a temperature change
questions.explanation:
1. Molar heat capacity is the same as the heat capacity per unit mole. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. The molar heat capacity and specific heat capacity are two different things (molar heat capacity is per mole, specific heat capacity is per unit mass, like grams). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. Heat capacity depends on the state and properties of the substance under consideration. Solid ice and liquid water have different states (liquid vs solid) and properties. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. There is no information to support this statement, and we know that heat capacity in general is dependent on the state and properties of the substances (so a gas might not have the same specific heat capacity as a solid substance). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. Since heat capacity is equal to the ratio of the heat added to an object to the resulting temperature change, a temperature change must be involved in the calculations of heat capacity. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

stems.text:
Matter in the solid state maintains a fixed volume and shape, with component particles (atoms, molecules or ions) close together and fixed into place. Matter in the liquid state maintains a fixed volume, but has a variable shape that adapts to fit its container. Its particles are still close together but move freely. Matter in the gaseous state has both variable volume and shape, adapting both to fit its container. Its particles are neither close together nor fixed in place.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_matter

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Matter in liquid and solid forms share at least one common physical property
Matter in gaseous state can fit into a 250cm3 and 300cm3 box
If matter in a solid state and matter in a liquid state were poured into the same box, they would maintain the same volume as each other
Particles in matter in the liquid state are close together
The reason matter in the solid state maintains a fixed volume is because its particles are close together
questions.explanation:
1. Matter in the solid and liquid state both maintain a fixed volume. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. Matter in a gaseous state has variable volume, and adapts to fit its container, so it would be able to fit both boxes. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
3. Matter in a solid state and liquid state have a fixed volume, but that does not mean that they will have the same volume as each other when put in the same box. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
4. In matter in the liquid state, its particles are still close together but move freely. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. We know that matter in the solid state has particular close together and has a fixed volume, but we do not know that this is the reason for the fixed volume (there could be any number of reasons that are not mentioned here). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

stems.text:
Like a gas, plasma does not have definite shape or volume. Unlike gases, plasmas are electrically conductive, produce magnetic fields and electric currents, and respond strongly to electromagnetic forces. Positively charged nuclei swim in a 'sea' of freely-moving disassociated electrons, similar to the way such charges exist in conductive metal, where this electron 'sea' allows matter in the plasma state to conduct electricity.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/State_of_matter

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Gases do not have a definite volume and are electrically non-conductive
Gases respond weakly to electromagnetic forces
A conductive metal has similar physical properties to plasma
A conductive metal can conduct electricity
A non-conductive substance cannot have a ‘sea’ of electrons
questions.explanation:
1. Gas is similar to plasma in that it does not have a definitive shape or volume (thus we know gas has a definitive volume), and unlike gases plasma are electrically conductive (which means gases are not electrically conductive). Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. Unlike gases, plasmas are electrically conductive, produce magnetic fields and electric currents, and respond strongly to electromagnetic forces. We can infer that gases do not respond strongly to electromagnetic forces, but that does not mean they respond weakly (they could respond mildly for example). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. We only know that conductive metal and plasma share the existence of charges, which is linked to conducting electricity – a physical property. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. We know the electron sea allows matter in the plasma state to conduct electricity, and since conductive metals share this property, we can infer that they are also electrically conductive. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. The ‘sea’ of electrons mentioned is described as enabling the electrical conductivity, so if a substance were to have this ‘sea’ of electrons they could have electrical conductivity, but that does not mean that non-conductive substances cannot have this (they could have this ‘sea’, but maybe something else disrupts the electrical conductivity for example, we don’t know for sure). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

stems.text:
Many governments require food manufacturers to label the energy content of their products, to help consumers control their energy intake. In the European Union, manufacturers of packaged food must label the nutritional energy of their products in both kilocalories and kilojoules, when required. In the United States, the equivalent mandatory labels display only 'Calories' (kilocalories), often as a substitute for the name of the quantity being measured, food energy; an additional kilojoules figure is optional and is rarely used.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_energy

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Food manufacturers label the energy content of their products because they want their consumers to regulate their energy intake
Packaged food manufacturers in countries outside the European Union are not required to label the nutritional energy intake of their products
Packaged food manufacturers in the United States are not required to label the nutritional energy of their products in kilojoules
The measurement of kilocalories is more popular than kilojoules
If food manufacturers did not label the energy content of their products, consumers would not be able to control their energy intake
questions.explanation:
1. The governments want to help consumers control their energy intake, but the food manufacturers are required to do so by the government (so we don’t know if they would do it to help consumers control their energy intake without it being mandatory etc). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We know that the United States required nutritional energy intake labels, and (a) we can infer that the United States is outside of the European Union since it does not follow the same rules as them, the (b) we have no information about what other countries are doing (or not doing). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. The United States requires the labelling of the calories/kilocalories, and kilojoules figures are “optional”. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. Just because kilocalories is used more than kilojoules in the United States does not make it more popular (in the European Union, both are used for example). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
5. Although the labelling of energy content on food products was designed to help consumers control their energy intake, we have no information on whether it actually worked, or if this is the ONLY way consumers can regulate their energy intake. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

stems.text:
The amount of food energy associated with a particular food could be measured by completely burning only the dried food in a bomb calorimeter, a method known as direct calorimetry. However, the values given on food labels are not determined in this way. The reason for this is that direct calorimetry also burns the dietary fibre, and so does not allow for faecal losses; thus direct calorimetry would give systematic overestimates of the amount of fuel that actually enters the blood through digestion.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Food_energy

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: Direct calorimetry involves a bomb calorimeter
The amount of food energy of a particular food cannot be measured in a bomb calorimeter if the food contains water
The values of food energy on food labels do not using bomb calorimeters
Dietary fibre does not provide energy when consumed/digested
If food labels were to use direct calorimetry to determine the energy of the food, they would be overestimating the energy content of the food
questions.explanation:
1. The method of completely burning only the dried food in a bomb calorimeter is known as direct calorimetry. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
2. The amount of food energy in a particular food can be measured by completely burning ONLY the dried food in a bomb calorimeter, so if the food had water in it, the measurements would not be accurate or the mechanism would not work etc, as it states that the food needs to be dried first. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
3. Democracy is a system of government where the citizens exercise power by voting. In a direct democracy, the citizens as a whole form a governing body and vote directly on each issue. In a representative democracy the citizens elect representatives from among themselves. These representatives meet to form a governing body. In a constitutional democracy the powers of the majority are exercised within the framework of a representative democracy, but the constitution limits the majority and protects the minority, usually through the enjoyment by all of certain individual rights, e.g. freedom of speech, or freedom of association.
Source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Government

A republic is a form of government in which the country is considered a 'public matter', not the private concern or property of the rulers, and where offices of states are subsequently directly or indirectly elected or appointed rather than inherited. The people, or some significant portion of them, have supreme control over the government and where offices of state are elected or chosen by elected people. A common simplified definition of a republic is a government where the head of state is not a monarch. Hydroelectric power plants can include a reservoir (generally created by a dam) to exploit the energy of falling water, or can use the kinetic energy of water as in run-of-the-river hydroelectricity. Hydroelectric plants can vary in size from small community sized plants (micro hydro) to very large plants supplying power to a whole country. 4. Medical earners = 15.7%, whereas lawyers = 8.4%. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. Financial professions = 13.9%. Blue collar or miscellaneous service = 3.8% (even though we don’t know the number, we know that these percentages are all of the same population). Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.

5. Social networking is used by a greater percentage of 18-29 year olds than 30-49 year olds, however that does not necessitate popularity in people in general (this graph is only for Americans), and we do not know the number of 18-29 year olds or 30-49 year olds. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

stems.text: The following graph shows the world population growth between 1750 and 2100 (projected).

questions.text: Place 'Yes' if the conclusion does follow. Place 'No' if the conclusion does not follow.
options: The annual growth rate of the world population and the world population are equal in 2000
By 2100 the world population will have surpassed the annual growth rate of the world population
The world population has increased by approximately 0.75 billion between 1800 and 1900
In at least one 100 year period, the world population has increased by more than double
At no point in the future will the world population begin to decrease at this rate
questions.explanation:
1. Just because the two lines intersect in 2000 does not mean they have the same value, as the y-axis for the Annual growth rate of the world population is not the same as World population (ie. one is a percentage, the other is in number of people). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
2. We cannot compare the growth rate to the world population as they are not the same ‘type’ of number (one is a percentage, the other is in terms of people/numbers). Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
3. 1900 population = 1.65 billion. 1800 population = 0.9 billion. Thus, 1.65 – 0.9 = 0.75 billion increase. Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
4. From 1900 to 2000, the population increased from 1.65 billion to more than 4.4 billion, so we can infer that the population in 2000 was well more than double the population in 1900 (thus, the population increased by more than double in at least one 100 year period). Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. We cannot use this graph to predict the future, there is not enough information to make any extrapolations or predictions. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.

Therefore, the correct answer is YES, as the conclusion does follow.
5. Half of the degrees awarded to men in 2011-12 would be 387,705/2 = 193,852.5, which is less than the 212,471 degrees awarded to women in 2015-16. Therefore, the correct answer is NO, as the conclusion does not follow.
